result.execSummary:
All charges against Antonio A Avila in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Antonio A Avila is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. No contact with the victim J.A with exception of family court proceedings, family wizard and child exchange. (person, property, residence or family).

1:40 PM Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Antonio A Avila appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove appeared by video for Antonio A Avila. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Victim appears via zoom
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on May 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
